item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Ex-act-ly, pre-cisely: with your usual acuteness, you have hit the nail straight on the head." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Dread remorse when you are tempted to err, Miss Eyre; remorse is the poison of life." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds the most discoveries, is not "Eureka!" (I found it!) but 'That's funny..." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Thomas Sowell
item.description: "I have never understood why it is "greed" to want to keep the money you have earned but not greed to want to take somebody else's money." -- Thomas Sowell

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then — to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn." -- T.H. White

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "Education is experience, and the essence of experience is self-reliance." -- T.H. White

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Wilson Rawls
item.description: "I believe a boy can have anything in life that he wants once he starts working for it. The main thing is not to give up. It makes no difference how tough things get, just bow your back, keep working, and put your heart and soul into it. As you go along your way, live a good clean life, don't hurt anyone or anything, and always be honest. It doesn't hurt to pray a little, too. If you do all those things-someday you'll have your pony and gun. You'll get help when you least expect it." -- Wilson Rawls
